proxy_params_auth_deprecation.description:
Authentication details for the proxy configured in the {telegram_bot} integration should be moved into the {proxy_url} instead. Please update your configuration and restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.

The {proxy_params} config key will be removed in a future release.
proxy_params_auth_deprecation.title: {telegram_bot}: Proxy authentication should be moved to the URL

proxy_params_deprecation.description:
The {proxy_params} config key for the {telegram_bot} integration will be removed in a future release.

Authentication can now be provided through the {proxy_url} key.

The underlying library has changed to {httpx} which is incompatible with previous parameters. If you still need this functionality for other options, please leave a comment on the 'learn more' link.

Please update your configuration to remove the {proxy_params} key and restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.
proxy_params_deprecation.title: {telegram_bot}: Proxy params option will be removed

message_id.description: ID of the message to edit.
message_id.name: Message ID

authentication.description: Define which authentication method to use. Set to `digest` to use HTTP digest authentication, or `bearer_token` for OAuth 2.0 bearer token authentication. Defaults to `basic`.
authentication.name: Authentication method

file.description: Local path to a GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound.
file.name: File

message_thread_id.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only.
message_thread_id.name: Message thread ID

keyboard.description: List of rows of commands, comma-separated, to make a custom keyboard.

password.description: Password (or bearer token) for a URL which require HTTP authentication.

target.name: Target

verify_ssl.description: Enable or disable SSL certificate verification. Set to false if you're downloading the file from a URL and you don't want to validate the SSL certificate of the server.
verify_ssl.name: Verify SSL
